de.wwu.muggl.ui.gui.support
Class StepByStepLoggingAppender

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.log4j.AppenderSkeleton
      de.wwu.muggl.ui.gui.support.StepByStepLoggingAppender
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.apache.log4j.Appender, org.apache.log4j.spi.OptionHandler
public class StepByStepLoggingAppender
extends org.apache.log4j.AppenderSkeleton

Log4j Logging Appender to be used in the StepByStepExecutionWindow. It will forward the time, the level and the message to the window so it can be displayed there. It extends the AppenderSkeleton of the org.apache.log4j package.

Version:
1.0.0, 2007-10-14
Author:
Tim Majchrzak

Method Detail

append

public void append(org.apache.log4j.spi.LoggingEvent event)
Overrides the super implementation and just forwards the time, the level and the message to the StepByStepExecutionComposite.

Specified by:
append in class org.apache.log4j.AppenderSkeleton
Parameters:
event - The LoggingEvent.

close

public void close()
Closing of this appender is not necessary. When closing the StepByStepExecutionComposite the Appender will be removed from the active appenders list of the logger.

Specified by:
close in interface org.apache.log4j.Appender
Specified by:
close in class org.apache.log4j.AppenderSkeleton

requiresLayout

public boolean requiresLayout()
Return false, the layout is determined by the StepByStepExecutionComposite.

Specified by:
requiresLayout in interface org.apache.log4j.Appender
Specified by:
requiresLayout in class org.apache.log4j.AppenderSkeleton
Returns:
False, since no Layout is required.
